GSD.description: Multiple buffer overflows in the (1) png_set_PLTE and (2) png_get_PLTE functions in libpng before 1.0.64, 1.1.x and 1.2.x before 1.2.54, 1.3.x and 1.4.x before 1.4.17, 1.5.x before 1.5.24, and 1.6.x before 1.6.19 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a small bit-depth value in an IHDR (aka image header) chunk in a PNG image.

description_data.value: Multiple buffer overflows in the (1) png_set_PLTE and (2) png_get_PLTE functions in libpng before 1.0.64, 1.1.x and 1.2.x before 1.2.54, 1.3.x and 1.4.x before 1.4.17, 1.5.x before 1.5.24, and 1.6.x before 1.6.19 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a small bit-depth value in an IHDR (aka image header) chunk in a PNG image.

reference_data.name: [oss-security] 20151112 CVE request: libpng buffer overflow in png_set_PLTE

advisories.affected_versions: All versions before 1.0.64, all versions starting from 1.1.1 before 1.2.54, all versions starting from 1.3.0 before 1.4.17, all versions starting from 1.5.0 before 1.5.24, all versions starting from 1.6.0 before 1.6.19
advisories.description: Multiple buffer overflows in the (1) png_set_PLTE and (2) png_get_PLTE functions in libpng  allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a small bit-depth value in an IHDR (aka image header) chunk in a PNG image.
advisories.not_impacted: All versions starting from 1.0.64 before 1.1.1, all versions starting from 1.2.54 before 1.3.0, all versions starting from 1.4.17 before 1.5.0, all versions starting from 1.5.24 before 1.6.0, all versions starting from 1.6.19
advisories.title: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')

description_data.value: Multiple buffer overflows in the (1) png_set_PLTE and (2) png_get_PLTE functions in libpng before 1.0.64, 1.1.x and 1.2.x before 1.2.54, 1.3.x and 1.4.x before 1.4.17, 1.5.x before 1.5.24, and 1.6.x before 1.6.19 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a small bit-depth value in an IHDR (aka image header) chunk in a PNG image.

reference_data.name: [oss-security] 20151112 CVE request: libpng buffer overflow in png_set_PLTE
